result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony R Buck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $425.00 payable to George N.  To be paid first, before costs/surcharges/assessments.

Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment unless in schoool.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.  Obtain GED or HSED.
Vocational assessment. Participate in any programs recommended.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with George N.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Anger management assessment. Cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.
Attend parenting classes.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony R Buck

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Decision and order DENYING the defendant's request for sentence credit. Copies to DA's office and the defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.
Letter from defendant re:  sentence credit and financial obligations.
Denying Request for Eligibility for Substance Abuse Program, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for eligibility for Substance Abuse Program.
Filed:  Decision and Order Denying Request for Concurrent Sentence.

Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the defendant's request for a concurrent sentence filed 2/19/16 is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. mag
Original transcript of 9/28/15 sentencing hearing, received and filed.
Letter to defendant holding request for concurrent sentence in abeyance pending filing of sentencing transcript.
Request for sentencing transcript sent to court reporter Diana Hausman.
Defendant's pro se request for concurrent sentence.

Defendant Anthony R Buck in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Defendant Anthony R Buck in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 31 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 13 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $425.00 payable to George N.  Restitution to be paid before any Court costs, fees and assessments; to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-Attend parenting classes
-No contact with George N.  
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he  may not vote in any election until his  civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Anthony R Buck in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Defendant Anthony R Buck in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge be amended to a Class I felony, which is Theft in the amount of $2,500-$10,000.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY on the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty to the amended charges and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Laurence M Moon in court, defendant Anthony R Buck not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties may have resolved this matter.  Case adjourned for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Moon in court requesting time change for the final pretrial from 1:30 p.m. to 8:30 a.m.  Defendant at the House of Corrections and should be produced for the morning calendar.  ADA Megan Carmody notified of the time change via email.

Attorney Laurence M Moon in court, defendant Anthony R Buck not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.   Parties request another Final Pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Laurence M Moon in court, defendant Anthony R Buck not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn for Megan Carmondy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requested final pre-trial and just trial dates. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anthony R Buck in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Defendant Anthony R Buck in custody.  Ronald Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense motion to dismiss the criminal complaint is reviewed and denied by the Court. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Joseph Roy-Wauwatosa Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with George N., Melissa Buck and Albert Martinez or Co-Defendants.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony R Buck in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Anthony R Buck in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP
